summary:
**Meeting Overview:**
The Quality of Life, Arts, and Culture Committee of the Dallas City Council will convene on September 16, 2024, at 9:00 AM in the Council Chambers, City Hall. The meeting aims to discuss various updates and proposals related to arts, culture, and community services in Dallas.

**Key Agenda Items:**
1. Approval of the minutes from the August 19, 2024, meeting.
2. Briefings on:
   - Historic Preservation updates.
   - Short-Term Rentals status and compliance.
   - Updates on the Dallas Theater Center partnership.
   - An amendment to the Senior Services Ombudsman Program contract.
   - Proposed elimination of the Hotspot Loaning Program.

**Important Details:**
- The Historic Preservation update will cover staffing changes, recent successes, and upcoming projects.
- The Short-Term Rentals briefing will address service requests, registration status, and Hotel Occupancy Tax collections, highlighting ongoing legal injunctions affecting enforcement.
- The Dallas Theater Center will provide updates on its management of city-owned facilities and upcoming funding considerations.
- The amendment for the Senior Services Ombudsman Program seeks to correct funding discrepancies, increasing the contract amount to $301,736.
- The proposed elimination of the Hotspot Loaning Program is a cost-saving measure aimed at reallocating resources to maintain library services.

**Action Items:**
- Approval of the meeting minutes.
- Discussion and potential approval of the amendment to the Senior Services contract.
- Consideration of the proposed elimination of the Hotspot Loaning Program.
- Updates and feedback on all briefing items to inform future decisions. 

This meeting will be accessible both in-person and via video conference, ensuring public participation.
